result.execSummary:
The defendant John W Hightower was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carrying Concealed Weapon. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John W Hightower

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John W Hightower appeared by video.  Attorney Sam Obscherning appeared by video for John W Hightower.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. 
Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered charge AMENDED to Carry Concealed Weapon, County Ordinance 63.015 to which defendant plead no contest. Court found defendant guilty of the amended charge and and ordered defendant to pay a forfeiture of $500.00 inclusive of all costs to be paid within 3 MONTHS. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

Defendant John W Hightower in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  John W Hightower appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for a deferred prosecution agreement hearing. Defense is in receipt of a new offer from the State. Offer was placed on the record. Defendant needs time to complete a firearm safety course.
Case adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant John W Hightower in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  John W Hightower appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests a DPA resolution date.  Case adjourned to Branch 30. Deferred Prosecution Agreement Hearing is scheduled on July 13, 2022 at 2:00pm.

Defendant John W Hightower in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  John W Hightower appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer from the state. Case may resolve as a DPA. Defense requests status date to determine case posture.  Case adjourned to Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (4/1/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant John W Hightower in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/30/22 @ 2p
